page.title: 11WITHERS FRUIT FARM CONT.
page.content: This is a well patronized{fruit farm and the{prices for 1985 for fruits}are as follows:- Raspberries, strawberries logan, tay, blackberries 36 pence per pound, gooseberries 20p, blackcurrants 25p, red currants 30p, apples and pears (many different varieties) and plums 15 - 20p per pound. However{95% of the fruit}is sent to the local{Wye Fruit Co-op in Ledbury, which is a subsiduary of{Home Grown {Fruits of Canterbury.}From here soft {fruits are marketed}straight to the shops and apples and pears are put in a{special cold store. Fruit is not grown for jam etc. as the price barely covers the picking costs. {Three full-time men are employed}and {40 pickers}during the season, usually housewives and school leavers, who are slower, but more careful with the soft fruit than the travelling people.
